snippet: As the kingdom prepares to greet the president, it faces low oil prices, rising Iranian influence and fears of a widening rift with the United States.
abstract: Pres Obama is set to visit Saudi Arabia amid turmoil over oil prices, rising Iranian influence and fears of widening rift with United States; hopes to repair relations strained by large number of factors, including Arab uprisings of 2011 and Obama's decision to put fight against Islamic State ahead of Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad's ouster.

byline.original: By BEN HUBBARD and NICHOLAS KULISH
byline.contributor: Ben Hubbard reported from Riyadh, and Nicholas Kulish from New York.

lead_paragraph: As the kingdom prepares to greet the president, it faces low oil prices, rising Iranian influence and fears of a widening rift with the United States.

headline.main: Obama to Visit a Saudi Arabia Deep in Turmoil
headline.print_headline: Obama to Visit a Saudi Arabia Deep in Turmoil

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
